input.DevelopmentDescription: Reserved matters application for the erection 188 dwellings following outline approval 07/2012/0729/OUT. Matters of layout, scale, appearance and landscaping are applied for (Amended Site Layout Plan)
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

input.DevelopmentDescription: Outline application for the erection of 35 No dwellings and creation of new access onto Dunkirk Lane (Access Only) - Renewal of permission 07/2008/0422/OUT
input.Notes:
May come forward with Rear of Dunkirk Mill.  

Site clearance completed at the beginning of the year, construction unlikely to start until 2019.  

07/2012/0551/REN - approved 31/3/15.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

input.DevelopmentDescription: Erection of a Residential development  - Outline application with all matters reserved for approx 234 dwellings with associated ground works, access arrangements and demolition.
input.Notes:
D1 - Housing.  07/2013/0288/FUL approved 30/8/13. (234 dwellings full/234 dwellings outline) - the outline approval relates to this part of the site.  S106.

AH - Phase 2 - up to a minimum of 20 units in accordance with a reserved matters approval taking account of any review pursuant to Part 4 of Schedule 3 of S106 agreement.  UU still on site.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
input.SiteNameAddress: "Farington Business Park, east of Wheelton Lane (northern section) - Phase 2"

input.DevelopmentDescription:
Outline application for the erection of approximately 385 dwellings. This is hybrid application which includes two parts -

Part A : Outline application permission (excluding Phase 1) for the erection of up to 204 dwellings, with the provision of associated infrastructure (including roads, footpath,cycleways and open space). All matters reserved for subsequent approval 

PART B: Full planning permission (Phase 1 as shown on the plans) for the erection of 181 dwellings and the provision of associated infrastructure (including roads, footpaths, cycleways and open spaces)
input.Notes:
Hybrid application approved 20/2/17.

The public house has been vacated.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
input.SiteNameAddress: "Vernon Carus Site/Penwortham Mills, Factory Lane - Phase 2"

input.DevelopmentDescription:
Outline application for the erection of approximately 385 dwellings. This is hybrid application which includes two parts -

Part A : Outline application permission (excluding Phase 1) for the erection of up to 204 dwellings, with the provision of associated infrastructure (including roads, footpath,cycleways and open space). All matters reserved for subsequent approval 

PART B: Full planning permission (Phase 1 as shown on the plans) for the erection of 181 dwellings and the provision of associated infrastructure (including roads, footpaths, cycleways and open spaces)
input.Notes:
Hybrid application approved 20/2/17.

The public house has been vacated.

input.SiteNameAddress: "Vernon Carus Site/Penwortham Mills, Factory Lane - Phase 3"

input.DevelopmentDescription: Planning permission does not currently exist for the residential development of the site but it could accommodate approximately 60 dwellings.  Any residential layout will have to take account of the proximity of the railway on the southern boundary of the site.  (Excerpt from Local Plan - adopted July 2015.)
input.Notes: Network Rail is promoting the site's availability to deliver a greater density than suggeste in the Local Plan (210 as opposed to 60).
input.OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority

input.DevelopmentDescription: The site is well-located close to the centre of Lostock Hall and suitable for redevelo9pment for housing.  The develo9pment must provide for an appropriate area of on-site open space to mitigate against the loss of the school playing field.  (Excerpt from Local Plan - adopted July 2015.)
input.Notes: 07/2007/0312/FUL - demolition/36 residential (21 market/15 affordable) withdrawn April 2008.  Dependent on LCC wanting to dispose of asset.
input.OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority

input.DevelopmentDescription:
The site has the potential to provide a comprehensive development with both residential and employment uses (including local services).   A masterplan will be required to take the principles of the approved development brief forward to achieve a comprehensive and sustainable development of high quality.  (Excerpts from Local Plan - adopted July 2015.).

The masterplan for this site has been approved.
input.NonHousingDevelopment: The approved masterplan proposes 6 ha employment land, 1.85 ha for a local centre and 1.6 ha for a primary school.
input.Notes: Masterplan approved, part full/part outline.  Application anticiapted in autumn 2017.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

input.DevelopmentDescription: Coupe's Foundry remains operational and the site comprises buildings and extensive areas of open storage.  (Excerpt from Local Plan - adopted 2015.)
input.Notes: Expired application.  Intention to re-submit application at a later date.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

input.DevelopmentDescription: The redevelopment of the site for housing is appropriate as a result of the site's relationship to the larger Lostock Hall Gasworks Site to the north.  Redevlopment will also result in significant environmental and visual improvements in the locality.  (Excerpt from Local Plan - adopted 2015.)
input.Notes: Land has been remediated.  Not scheduled to be under construction until 2019.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority

input.DevelopmentDescription: Outline Application for the erection of 1 No. dwellinghouse
input.NonHousingDevelopment: Permission includes 2 ground floor retail units.
input.Notes: 07/2015/1301/OUT approved October 2015.
input.OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
